Hi,

Not sure why your Java app does not use Java's corba ability (a good Java 
ORB being http://www.jacorb.org/ ), instead of JNI...

Anyway, onto your real question, how do I test the code that is dependant 
upon the other servers?

As you are asking on the JUnit list I take it you mean Unit test?
Not System or Integration testing?

If so, then you will find unit testing much simpler and (imo) better, if 
none of your unit tests need to access any file, network, database or UI. 
This means they run very fast. Once you figure out how to do them, you 
should be able to write lots of them , quickly too.

We could just give you some simple examples, but I tend to find it better 
to show you how to unit test one of your classes that depend on corba or 
some other system, by using one of your real classes.  So, please post 
(just one) class and we'll knock up a unit test for it.

Regards

Andrew

Hi Group
Greetings to all. These days I am writting test suit for a CORBA CRM. Let 
me first introduce the system.

There is a central ORB server and many other servers which talk to each 
other through vesp. ORB being the central one. Entire code base is in C++. 
I have to test a new server introduced in the system which is written in 
Java. This new server talks to the rest through JNI. As a matter of Fact 
none of the servers can run independently, they neccesirily have to log 
into the central kit and report to the the central ORB server. After 
validation stuff the server starts working.

Even this new Java based server uses an executable file to work 
(Jloader.exe written in c++)

This .exe loads various .dll files in the system and in its main method 
calls the compiled .class files. This is the way how system functions.

My problem is that when I will write a JUnit test case in IDE (eclipse) 
which would operate on the actual code which has 99% dependency and cannot 
be tested isolated. Is there any way to test this server code while it is 
working under the live system and the test suite running in the eclipse 
IDE.

HELP !!!

Thanks
Avinash
